title: Gilda
occurrences: - Gilda, are you decent? - Me?
Gilda, this is Johnny Farrel. Johnny, this is Gilda.
No, I wanted to save that as a surprise too. Gilda is my wife.
Let's have dinner. Gilda is much too beautiful to be left alone.
Anyone as superstitious as Gilda, out loud, asking for disaster.
I see. You're a child, Gilda. A beautiful, greedy child.
Let's join Gilda for a drink.
All right. Gilda was right, you are protective.
Gilda warned me that you'd grow up. By the way, where is she?
With you and Gilda on my side... You are on my side?
- I told you that. - And Gilda?
That's just it. Money doesn't mean much to Gilda.
- Late to bed, early to rise... - Let Gilda talk, Johnny.
- Pretty good. - Did you teach Gilda how to swim?
Gilda?
Just by closing a window. Remember that, Gilda.
- Where's Gilda? - I can't keep track, in this mob.
- Did you find Gilda? - No.
Gilda!
In his will, Ballin left everything to Gilda, with me as sole executor.
But Gilda couldn't stand not knowing the why of things, -
I'm Gilda, your wife. Remember?
You didn't hear a word of it. All you can think of is Gilda.
When you sent for me, I sent for Gilda. She's going home.
Gilda didn't do any of those things you've been losing sleep over.
I want to go with you, Gilda. Please take me.
- so I disappeared for a while. I came to the house to get Gilda.
But now it won't do, because I have to kill Gilda, too.
